pr_title: Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to check the number of output fields every time you check for output types. So split the check into 2 parts. Check for number of fields, and check for field types. Or better, change this function to take a list of output types, and call this outside of the for loop.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.message:
Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

UNION DISTINCT can be expensive, when there is a lot of data involved.
We are sending a warning when there there are many visible fields, and
some may be expensive to process.  The current criteria are, that there
are greater than 3 visible fields, and that one is a complex type.

Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

UNION DISTINCT can be expensive, when there is a lot of data involved.
We are sending a warning when there there are many visible fields, and
some may be expensive to process.  The current criteria are, that there
are greater than 3 visible fields, and that one is a complex type.

Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

UNION DISTINCT can be expensive, when there is a lot of data involved.
We are sending a warning when there there are many visible fields, and
some may be expensive to process.  The current criteria are, that there
are greater than 3 visible fields, and that one is a complex type.

timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: What about naming this function isExpensiveUnionDistinct to be consistent with the SQL?
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: maybe just do Arrays.stream(outoutTypes).anyMatch(type -> type instanceof RealType || type instanceof DoubleType || type instanceof MapType || type instanceof ArrayType) instead. Normally we don't put simple logic in separate functions if they are not reused much. Also REAL and DOUBLE are not really complex types. Oh, maybe also add RowType to the check.
timeline.author: rongrong
rongrong
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1631,6 +1666,26 @@ public void setup()
                         new ColumnMetadata("d", new ArrayType(DOUBLE)))),
                 false));
 
+        // table with three doubles

timeline.message:
Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

UNION DISTINCT can be expensive, when there is a lot of data involved.
We are sending a warning when there there are many visible fields, and
some may be expensive to process.  The current criteria are, that there
are greater than 3 visible fields, and that one is a complex type.

Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

UNION DISTINCT can be expensive, when there is a lot of data involved.
We are sending a warning when there there are many visible fields, and
some may be expensive to process.  The current criteria are, that there
are greater than 3 visible fields, and that one is a real/double or
complex type.

Warn when using expensive UNION DISTINCT queries

UNION DISTINCT can be expensive, when there is a lot of data involved.
We are sending a warning when there there are many visible fields, and
some may be expensive to process.  The current criteria are, that there
are greater than 3 visible fields, and that one is a real/double or
complex type.

timeline.bodyText: My apologies. I should've been more thorough before. The error message didn't mention types. So it could be confusing if the warning is actually triggered by using DOUBLE / complex types rather than exceeding 3 fields. So let's mention both here.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText:
Since we are updating the change, let's also reformat this:

The codebase normally put && or || at the end of the previous line rather than beginning of next.
streaming API would put each method on a new line after .stream()
Personally if the predicates don't all fit in one line I always break them to be one line each

So something like the following:
    return setOperation instanceof Union &&
            setOperation.isDistinct() &&
            outputTypes.length > UNION_DISTINCT_FIELDS_WARNING_THRESHOLD &&
            Arrays.stream(outputTypes)
                    .anyMatch(
                            type -> type instanceof RealType ||
                                    type instanceof DoubleType ||
                                    type instanceof MapType ||
                                    type instanceof ArrayType ||
                                    type instanceof RowType);
timeline.author: rongrong
